title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for C( 4 )−C( 2 ) 4−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F74@

1 point is earned for the conclusion, using MVT

C is differentiable ⇒ C is continuous (on the closed interval)

C( 4 )−C( 2 ) 4−2 =  12.8−8.8 2   =2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B1F@

Therefore, by the Mean Value Theorem, there is at least one time t, 2 < t < 4, for which C'(t) = 2.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the midpoint sum

1 point is earned for the approximation

1 point is earned for the interpretation

1 6 ∫ 0 6 C( t )dt ≈ 1 6 [ 2⋅C( 1 )+2⋅C( 3 )+2⋅C( 5 ) ]                        =  1 6 ( 2⋅5.3+2⋅11.2+2⋅13.8 )                        =  1 6 ( 60.6 )=10.1 ounces MathType@MTEF@5@5@@A1EF@

1 6 ∫ 0 6 C( t )dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40AC@ is the average amount of coffee in the cup, in ounces, over the time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 6 minutes.
